contentrichtext.text: {{chembox | Verifiedfields = changed | verifiedrevid = 457287598 | Reference=<ref>[http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/search/ProductDetail/ALDRICH/201677 Janus Green B], at [[Sigma-Aldrich]]</ref> | ImageFile = Janus green B.svg | ImageSize = 200px | IUPACName = 8-(4-Dimethylaminophenyl)diazenyl-''N'',''N''-diethyl-10-phenylphenazin-10-ium-2-amine chloride | OtherNames = Diazin Green S<br>Union Green B | Section1 = {{Chembox Identifiers | CASNo_Ref = {{cascite|changed|??}} | CASNo = 2869-83-2 | EINECS = 220-695-6 | ChemSpiderID_Ref = {{chemspidercite|correct|chemspider}} | ChemSpiderID = 68607 | ChEBI_Ref = {{ebicite|correct|EBI}} | ChEBI = 21184 | StdInChI_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChI = 1S/C30H31N6.ClH/c1-5-35(6-2)26-17-19-28-30(21-26)36(25-10-8-7-9-11-25)29-20-23(14-18-27(29)31-28)33-32-22-12-15-24(16-13-22)34(3)4;/h7-21H,5-6H2,1-4H3;1H/q+1;/p-1 | StdInChIKey_Ref = {{stdinchicite|correct|chemspider}} | StdInChIKey = XXACTDWGHQXLGW-UHFFFAOYSA-M | PubChem = 76123 | SMILES = CCN(CC)C1=CC2=[N+](C3=C(C=CC(=C3)N=NC4=CC=C(C=C4)N(C)C)N=C2C=C1)C5=CC=CC=C5.[Cl-] }} | Section2 = {{Chembox Properties | Formula = C<sub>30</sub>H<sub>31</sub>ClN<sub>6</sub> | MolarMass = 511.06 g/mol | Appearance = | Density = | MeltingPt = | BoilingPt = | Solubility = }} | Section3 = {{Chembox Hazards | MainHazards = | FlashPt = | Autoignition = }} }} '''Janus Green B''' is a basic [[dye]] and [[vital stain]] used in [[histology]]. It is also used to stain [[mitochondrion|mitochondria]] supravitally. The indicator Janus Green B changes colour according to the amount of oxygen present.<ref>http://www.mrothery.co.uk/bio_web_prac/practicals/2anaerobic%20resp%20student.doc</ref> *Oxygen present: Indicator oxidised to blue colour *Oxygen absent: Indicator reduced to pink colour ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Staining dyes]] [[Category:Azo dyes]] [[Category:Phenazines]] [[Category:Chlorides]] [[Category:Aromatic amines]] [[Category:Anilines]] {{organic-compound-stub}} {{Stains}}
